full_text: @g28308990 @Manu3l_pz @garutch @RosannaXia @ucsantabarbara Nah, they just need to get rid of it, and the ocean is a very big place you can make stuff go away.
@RosannaXia @ucsantabarbara Fantastic work!

@critworld2020 @rochellepigman @Rocatanski @RosannaXia @ucsantabarbara The chemical industry should be taxed to fund most it. Yes, it's not particularly fair, but neither is what the industry continues to do to our environment.

@dgurdasani1 Yes, and I don‚Äôt know how she thinks she is going to get tenure at @ucsantabarbara by behaving this way. Trying to shoot the messenger is not working, because the messenger won‚Äôt shut up and neither will an increasingly number of witnesses who are no longer afraid.
@rochellepigman @Rocatanski @RosannaXia @ucsantabarbara You're welcome. I agree.
@critworld2020 @Rocatanski @RosannaXia @ucsantabarbara Thank you üòä. So sad.

@rochellepigman @Rocatanski @RosannaXia @ucsantabarbara The entire superfund site is large and has other poisons besides ddt. The ddt barrels are in the deepest part and almost dead center the 20 mile span between land. The smaller area helps. The deeper location and strong currents complicate things.
@rochellepigman @Rocatanski @RosannaXia @ucsantabarbara Sorry about the repeat. It's late and I'm not going to retype it all. Lol

@rochellepigman @Rocatanski @RosannaXia @ucsantabarbara They dumped the stuff 50 years ago. They were sued and settled. All dead or poor by now. The only issue is will it be left be, encapsulated or removed. And who pays for it all? Tough call. The ddt levels near the barrels is high. Everywhere else is cleaned up a lot. Tough call.
@critworld2020 @Rocatanski @RosannaXia @ucsantabarbara We can still find the humans left who worked there and ran the company.

@AndyBalendy @RosannaXia @ucsantabarbara So horrific. I hope there is some pathway to address the damages. With Montrose out of business, it seems murky. The DDT problem was already big & now it‚Äôs massive - underscores the importance of public health outreach about contaminated fish.
@Manu3l_pz @garutch @RosannaXia @ucsantabarbara They must have known otherwise they wouldnt have hid them at sea.
RT @mbalter: @cici18480257 @ucsantabarbara PS‚ÄîI want to stress, and have it spread as widely as possible, that under no circumstances whats‚Ä¶

@critworld2020 @RosannaXia @ucsantabarbara Thanks for the answer - CA needs to do the clean up here : tax dollars will be better used than some other projects ‚Äî-

@Rocatanski @RosannaXia @ucsantabarbara They are long gone. They need robots to pick up the barrels and bring to surface. The county sewer dumps out there. It used to not treat the water much and it covered up the ddt. Now clean water flows into the ocean. Over time the poison becomes exposed. Strong currents there.
@RosannaXia @ucsantabarbara Which company did that ? Can we track them and sue them ? Thanks !
@RosannaXia @ucsantabarbara This just makes me sick. What human would do this to ourselves? What evil.

@cldelmonte Thank you for being responsible and reporting this instructor. I was shocked when I saw the stuff she posted on her social media. I can‚Äôt believe @ucsantabarbara would hire someone so openly bigoted against her minority students. Campuses should be a safe space for LGBT youth.

@ScouseJayne @ucsantabarbara Also, the school has a policy against bigotry, so the teacher should go. Obviously they aren‚Äôt going to suspect students for being against bigotry, as much as that triggers you.
@ucsantabarbara @AdrianStier I‚Äôm also curious how a maintenance request was made, since I never gave my building or room number?
@ucsantabarbara @AdrianStier I submitted a request earlier, talked to many people, and a facilities person was the one who told me to ‚Äúlive life on the edge‚Äù but thanks.
@ucsantabarbara @_JChildress Thank you! ‚ù§Ô∏è
